Create a Market Data Tibble

Source: R/market_tbl.R
market_tbl.Rd

Creates a standardized market data tibble (market_tbl) that serves as the foundation for all tradeengine operations. This is the core data structure used across the entire TradingVerse ecosystem.

Usage

market_tbl(
  symbol,
  datetime,
  open,
  high,
  low,
  close,
  volume,
  adjusted = NULL,
  frequency = "daily",
  timezone = "UTC",
  asset_class = "equity"
)

Arguments

symbol

Character vector of asset symbols/tickers

datetime

POSIXct vector of timestamps (timezone-aware)

open

Numeric vector of opening prices

high

Numeric vector of high prices

low

Numeric vector of low prices

close

Numeric vector of closing prices

volume

Numeric vector of trading volume

adjusted

Numeric vector of adjusted closing prices (optional)

frequency

Character string indicating data frequency (e.g., "1min", "1hour", "daily")

timezone

Character string for timezone (default: "UTC")

asset_class

Character string for asset class (e.g., "equity", "crypto", "futures", "fx")

Value

A market_tbl object (enhanced tibble) with standardized market data

Examples

# Create daily stock data
prices <- market_tbl(
  symbol = rep("AAPL", 5),
  datetime = seq.POSIXt(as.POSIXct("2024-01-01"), by = "day", length.out = 5),
  open = c(150, 151, 152, 151, 153),
  high = c(152, 153, 154, 153, 155),
  low = c(149, 150, 151, 150, 152),
  close = c(151, 152, 153, 152, 154),
  volume = c(1e6, 1.1e6, 1.2e6, 1.15e6, 1.3e6)
)

# Create crypto data with 1-hour frequency
btc <- market_tbl(
  symbol = rep("BTC-USD", 24),
  datetime = seq.POSIXt(as.POSIXct("2024-01-01"), by = "hour", length.out = 24),
  open = rnorm(24, 50000, 500),
  high = rnorm(24, 50500, 500),
  low = rnorm(24, 49500, 500),
  close = rnorm(24, 50000, 500),
  volume = rnorm(24, 100, 10),
  frequency = "1hour",
  asset_class = "crypto"
)
#> Warning: Inconsistent OHLC prices detected (high < low or similar)
